caption: From the same owners of Thip Khao, Hanumanh is even better than its older sibling. Though the menu is small, it more than makes up for it with FLAVOR! The tapioca dumplings were bursting with flavor, and it had a little heat at the end to round it all out! The beef cheek was quite flavorful as well and the sauce went well with it. The curry was delicious and had a very rich/umami flavor. The beef tongue was the only dish that didn't blow us away but was still good.  As for the drinks, we had the hanumanh and the toucan sam. Both were quite good. The toucan sam was very tropically, as you'd expect. Some drinks come in a fun container.  The food comes in small plates and most dishes range around $13-$16. 3-4 dishes filled us up as a group of 2 since all the dishes, except for the dumplings, came with rice.  Will definitely be back for the food alone!!!
Exceptional.  Hearty, spicy and delicious.  Not to be missed!
Excellent food from a unique menu.  I have never tasted flavors like that before.  Excellent service from waiter too.
Really interesting food options and delicious drinks. The Hanumanh cocktail tastes like a tropical smoothie.
The food is great!

I enjoyed this cozy little spot for Laotian food, something I can't readily find in my hometown. The menu is fairly small, but has some unusual, flavor-packed options. I started with the "blooming mushroom" (I learned it was a battered enoki) with fermented tofu and tamarind salt. Funky, sweet, sour and salty. It was a bit much for one person because of the richness and flavor intensity. I followed that with grilled pork jowls. There's something you don't find everyday! Also, rich and tasty. For those whose taste is less adventurous, the menu has dumplings and coconut curry. Note: their menu changes fairly often. I chased the richness with an unusually refreshing, spicy cocktail called the Som Nahm Nah ("you get what you deserve"). If they had a few more items like Lao salads or noodles, I would have given 5 stars. I will check it out again when I'm in DC and need to escape the tourist scene.
Get the curry!

From the family that brought you Thip Khao, meet their younger, hipper, more experimental kid brother. Amazing Laotian bar food with a real emphasis on the cocktails, and some super friendly bartenders bringing you incredibly unique flavors (highly recommend the house drink, the Hanumanh, with the sous vide banana and condensed milk!). The red crab curry and tapioca dumplings were also a huge hit, with happy hour specials making everything really reasonable.

The atmosphere, though cramped and boisterous, was upbeat and cheerful. The happy hour selection of cocktails and appetizers was both extensive and exceedingly delicious. The place is still finding it's rythm, so expect a slight delay at happy hour. But other than that, bring a sense of adventure and an appetite.

Friendly staff, amazing flavors and Lao’s beer selection. However super expensive- for Lao food. If you have been to Laos every meal with drinks included will be less than $10. Get ready to pay more than $40 per person- dishes are meant to share and are very small. But then again, flavors are amazing.
Red crab curry, beef meatballs, and silky tofu were all delicious. Almost good as Bad Saint. If you get there before 7, the happy hour prices are decent.

Delicious food and awesome drinks. Different from any other cuisine I have tried but the flavours, although unusual, are really spot-on. 4 stars only because I felt that the service was too rushed as they tried to collect plates with food in them multiple times.

Omg this was fantastic! Went with another guy and we shared a starter, a salad, and a curry. It wad the perfect amount of food, and it was all unique and delicious. We had the crab red curry and they really loaded it up with crab. So many other places would have skimped. It's a small place but has a nice bar and outdoor seating. The service was great. I absolutely recommend it.
Excellent food and service. Exceeded our expectations!

Went for dinner and was very impressed. I've been to Thip Kao (they own this place) so I knew what to expect but I think this place may be better. Less items overall but each one was great. We had the Naem Khao kob(rice salad) and the Ping khao jee and Awk Hoi (pictured)  the Ping khao was our favorite. Each item had a lot of flavor. Price is high but not out of the ordinary for the neighborhood. We will plan to come back soon!

Although delicious,  the portion size is too small for the price.  Pros: -The food was bursting with flavor combinations that I had never tasted. I was comfortably filled by splitting five dishes between three of us. -The service was attentive and quick. They brought each next dish when we were a minute from finishing our current dish. -The decor was lovely, especially the epic painted story-book walls.  Cons: -The price was high for how little food we got. You would never leave this place with leftovers. -The stools at our table were very impractical, with no comfortable way of sitting in them. Designed to keep tables turning?

Um...no. They try too hard and over think simple dishes. No licks..not one. Sakoo Yadsai...no, Chuenh Het  Pouk...no, Salat Hua Pii...NO, Gali Goong...no,no,no! You would think that with all these fancy names the dish would be spectacular. Little hot pepper rings on everything. Ha!, must have been for a splash of color because my beer had more heat than the dishes. 2 stars because they may get their act together and have a few people try the dishes before they go on the menu. Oh and here is a request...make the food like momma makes it. Don't overthink it, fancy it up or add ingredients that don't belong....and add some heat for goodness sakes!  P.S. Ditch the forks and spoons. Ugh  Shame on a chef that tries to run game on a chef...  Here is MEH FOX He thought is was blah too.

Hanumanh is a Laotian restaurant in Shaw. It's on a block with several other restaurants and bars. The space is small, but they lay it out well so you don't feel cramped. There's table seating and a long bar.  The bartender was friendly and recommended drinks for my buddy and I. I ordered a drink that came in a unique clay mug shaped liked a monkey. It had banana flavor in it, which I don't usually like, but I loved my cocktails.  We didn't order food, but those around us said they enjoyed their dishes.
Food. Drink. Service. Space. Decor. 👌👌✔️✔️
Delicious Laotian food and solid cocktails. The space is small, and it is a little loud, but I really enjoyed it. Not a huge menu, but everything we tried was delicious. I would definitely go back.

This place is really cute but with its small size comes a small menu. And small menu brings few veggie options. I enjoyed the puffed rice salad but wish there had been more dressing. It was the perfect amount of spicy! I didn’t like the fact that i was supposed to put the salad in the lettuce cups bc the lettuce pieces were too small to be cups and couldn’t fit anything. Also had the blooming mushroom. It was tasty but not the least bit hearty. Just like really really good fried stuff with not enough of this so called tofu sauce. The drinks, however, were creative and delicious we had the Hanumanh which was so interesting. And also had the gin drink with the pineapple syrup. Can’t remember the name. Really solid drinks. Didn’t taste the alcohol but had a nice buzz going.  The coconut pudding dessert was interesting. Light, refreshing and not too sweet. I wouldn’t get it again though.  Also important to add some of the prices for things were a bit absurd.  I probably wouldn’t go back there if it weren’t for the interesting drinks. Perhaps when they rotate the menu in the future I will be drawn to the food more again.

I had the dumplings and the pork jowl.  Been going to Thip Khao for years and absolutely love their spot.  This was a bit underwhelming.  The dumplings were definitely the highlight, the sour pork jowl was pretty flat, and the rice texture wasn't as good.  Really hope they step up their game because it's super close and I know the chef has better game than this.
Amazing food! Every bite is like an explosion of colorful fireworks!

The drinks and food were spectacular. Friendly staff and fun creative food and cocktails. I tried every drink and they were all amazing. Got a little shot of the banana Infused whiskey after chatting with Brendan the bartender which was so amazing. The beverage director Al (From Barmini) made us a drink off menu and it was fantastic. The Crab Curry was special and you should order it! All he drinks were amazing especially - Hanumahn, Tropical Kiss, Garden of the God's, and a Laotian name I couldn't prounounce but it was made with Aquavit and was super herbal and fresh. The off menu drink Space Romulus was superb. Will be back for more!

It's a pretty good spot! The plates are pretty small (and pricey),but the food is sooooo delicious.  I had the pork and mushrooms and tried the hunumanh drink.  The back patio is spacious and well lit. Expect some waiting time on weewkends cause it gets packed. Bon appetit!!!

Huge fan of Thip Khao so had high hopes for this place as well. Caveat: I'm a vegetarian. Compared to Thip Khao, this place is very limited for vegetarians. There's two salads available but all the grill and main dishes contain some sort of meat. Other than the limited menu, the drinks, decor, and atmosphere are fantastic. My girlfriend had the Red Curry with Crab and highly recommends it.

Some highs and less so but a nice new spot overall. The crab curry was one of the best dishes I’ve had in years and the Space Romulo cocktail was well balanced and delicious. The namesake Hanumanh cocktail, on the other hand, was like drinking simple syrup - tasty but much much too sweet. And the coconut pudding with granita was an interesting idea that didn’t really work. I’ll be back for sure to try the dumplings, which my bar neighbors raved about. Hopefully they’ll minimize the extreme sweetness in the cocktail options.

Have you tried Laotian food? The flavors are very bright and fresh and have just the right spark of heat . The crab curry here was amazing . Instead of thick , it had a lighter broth and was filled with lots of crab. The Tapioca dumplings were unique and yummy. The noodles and salads have herbs and fish sauce and nice touches of spice and citrus . Additionally the bar program adds great drinks to the game . Headed up by Al Thompson ex Bar Mini. You won’t be disappointed .
Nice mix of comfort food and yummy flavors
